talk.author: did:plc:zyqqdlcvyjvph5hpv36dqajy
talk.utter: I didn't understand «though as you'll discover, it's more like them training you» when I read this, but after giving the Jays in my street treats for a few months I understand now.

talk.author: did:plc:zyqqdlcvyjvph5hpv36dqajy
talk.utter:
Although them recognizing me seems very tied to my house and street. They don't come to me anymore after I'm more than 50 meters from my house.

Can you tell more about this?

talk.author: did:plc:tbqqvyv6pjjww44glrmycaxl
talk.utter: I haven’t experienced this with crows. A jays thing perhaps? I don’t have an explanation.

talk.author: did:plc:zyqqdlcvyjvph5hpv36dqajy
talk.utter: Actually, looks like I meant Western Jackdaws. The English names for some of them aren't familiar to me.
